ref: 2576 kaṁsá1 m. ʻ metal cup ʼ AV., m.n. ʻ bell -- metal ʼ Pat. as in S., but would in Pa. Pk. and most NIA. lggs. collide with kāˊṁsya -- to which L. P. testify and under which the remaining forms for the metal are listed. 2. *kaṁsikā -- .
Pa. kaṁsa -- m. ʻ bronze dish ʼ;
Or. kãsā ʻ big pot of bell -- metal ʼ; O
Marw. kāso (= kã̄ -- ?) m. ʻ bell -- metal tray for food, food ʼ;
G. kã̄sā m. pl. ʻ cymbals ʼ; -- perh.

lang: Woṭapūrī (language of Woṭapūr and Kaṭārqalā — Dard.)
ref: Woṭ. kasṓṭ m. ʻ metal pot ʼ Buddruss Woṭ 109.
